History

We could make better one thus we do it. why not!

  • Version History
  • Ideas
  • Why summernote?

Version History

0.5 2013-12-29

Restructuring, Video, Languages and CodeMirror as Codeview.

  • Restructuring: jQuery build pattern
  • Support both Font-Awesome 3.x and 4.x
  • CodeMirror as Codeview
  • Insert Video (by cdownie)
  • Support 5 languages(by hendrismit, tschiela, inomies, cverond)

0.4 2013-11-01

View mode

  • Support both Bootstrap 3.0 and 2.x
  • Fullscreen
  • Code view
  • Image upload callback

0.3 2013-09-01

Init options and resizebar.

  • Init options(event callbacks, custom toolbar)
  • Resize bar and help dialog
  • Supporting IE8(Beta)
  • Bug patch

0.2 2013-08-01

Implemented undo/redo and image sizing.

  • Undo/Redo
  • Sizing handle and Popover for images
  • Supporting multiple editors
  • jQuery.curstyles dependency removed

0.1 2013-07-01

Initial version: Implement basic features.

  • Font style: size, color, bold, italic, underline, remove font style
  • Paragraph style: bullet, align, outdent, indent, line height
  • Image: drag & drop, dialog
  • Link: popover and dialog
  • Table: create table with dimension picker

Ideas

I tried many bootstrap wysiwyg editors. They suck! We surely made a better one. Alan's code is much more efficient than others.

We made simple implementations.

  • Easy file upload with common server side languages
  • Auto-resize image file
  • Great table features and easy editing shortcuts
  • Providing nowadays interaction for text editing tool

We spent a less time for summernote in a own company but code grows up. and now some nice guys help us for debug, quality, idea

Why summernote?

Alan made a documentation tool similar to google docs for his company’s project. Then he spent time to make his own simple editor on bootstrap. When I heard the news, I needed to see Alan. I know all web developers have thirst for their own customized web editors.

So he exposed summernote in github.

Summernote v0.5 · Created and Maintained by Alan

Based on Bootstrap and jQuery. Icons from Font Awesome. Theme from bootswatch.

Summernote distributed under the MIT license.
